intro: Thryallis vestita, commonly known as the velvetleaf thryallis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Thryallis vestita is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
